ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Cable Modem question
ygData.msgSnippet: I run on a cable modem and do not have many issues at all.  The only lag I get is in Heavily populated small zones and I believe that is more a function of my
ygData.messageBody:
I run on a cable modem and do not have many issues at all.  The only lag I get is in Heavily populated small zones and I believe that is more a function of my 200Mhz CPU and 64MB Ram than my connection.
 
Kelvanan Ixtaz
27 Necromancer
Kindred Companions
Prexus
----- Original Message -----
From: Nat Russo
To: EQ_Necromancers
Sent: Tuesday, May 09, 2000 5:03 PM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Cable Modem question

Hi folks,

I recently moved to a neighborhood where Roadrunner Cable Modem service is
available.  I was going to just keep my 56K dialup connection, but due to
the phone wiring in the neighborhood (paired-back copper more than 15000
feet from a substation) the highest connection speed I can get is 26.4K.

My question is this:  Other than the fact that a cable modem connection
slows down with each additional person logged in, are there any known issues
with running a cable modem and playing Everquest?

Secondly, will this faster connection actually benefit me in any way (with
regard to playing Everquest)?

Thanks in advance for the info.

Mujahid  26 Necro  Solusek Ro
This list is basically unmoderated.  However abusive language will not be tolerated
